metadata.job_to_be_done: Create and manage fillable forms for onboarding and compliance.

extracted_sections.section_title: Show or activate PDFMaker in Microsoft Office and Lotus Notes

subsection_analysis.refined_text:
1. Interactive forms: These contain fields that you can select and fill in.
- For example, a job application form with multiple choice questions or a survey 
form with multiple answer options.
2. Flat forms: These do not have interactive fields. It could be a paper form or PDF 
that hasn't been optimized for form filling. The Fill & Sign tool automatically 
detects the form fields like text fields, comb fields, checkboxes, and radio buttons. 
- For example, a customer service form with a list of questions or a survey form with 
multiple choice questions.
3. Manual filling: You can manually add text and other symbols to fill in any missing 
fields on the PDF forms.
4. Filing & signing: The Fill & Sign tool automatically detects the form fields like 
text fields, comb fields, checkboxes, and radio buttons. You can then manually 
add text and other symbols to fill in any missing fields on the PDF forms.
5. Customization: You can customize the PDF forms by adding your company logo or 
branding elements.
6. Optimization: The Fill & Sign tool automatically

1. Open Microsoft Office or Lotus Notes application.
2. Click on File > Preferences in the menu bar.
3. In the dialog box that appears, click on Toolbar > Toolbars.
4. Select the Visible option for Acrobat PDFMaker.
5. The PDF toolbar buttons should now appear in your Microsoft Office or Lotus Notes application.

Concise:
1. Open Microsoft Office or Lotus Notes application.
2. Click on File > Preferences in the menu bar.
3. In the dialog box that appears, click on Toolbar > Toolbars.
4. Select the Visible option for Acrobat PDFMaker.
5. The PDF toolbar buttons should now appear in your Microsoft Office or Lotus Notes application.

- "Print to" (prints to a specific printer)
- "Print to default printer" (prints to the default printer)
- "Print to all printers" (prints to all available printers on your system)
- "Print to this printer" (prints to the printer you are currently using)
- "Print to this printer and save as..." (prints to a specific printer, saves the printout to a new file with a specified name, and closes the Print dialog box)
- "Print to this printer and save as PDF" (prints to a specific printer, saves the printout to a PDF file with a specified name, and closes the Print dialog box)
- "Print to this printer and save as... (PDF)" (prints to a specific printer, saves the printout to a PDF file with a specified name, and closes the Print dialog box)
- "Print to this printer and save as... (XLS)" (prints to a specific printer, saves the printout to an Excel spreadsheet with a specified name, and closes the Print dialog box)
- "Print to this printer and save as... (DOC)" (prints

1. Fill and Sign PDF Forms:
a. Open the form in Acrobat and select E-Sign from the global bar. Alternatively, you can select All tools > Fill & Sign.
b. It displays the Fill & Sign tools in the left panes.
c. You can now fill in the form fields and sign the form using the sign tools described in the following topics:
i. Fill in the form fields with your signature, then select the appropriate sign tool from the list.
ii. If you want to add a digital seal or a stamp, select the appropriate option from the list.
iii. Once you've selected the desired sign tool, click on the "Sign" button to complete the process.
2. Sign PDF Forms:
a. Open the form in Acrobat and select E-Sign from the global bar. Alternatively, you can select All tools > Fill & Sign.
b. It displays the Fill & Sign tools in the left panes.
c. You can now sign the form using the sign tools described in the following topics:

Conclusion:
Sharing PDFs with Adobe Acrobat is straightforward and efficient, regardless of the project or real estate documents involved. By following the checklists provided, you can ensure that your sharings are smooth and professional. Start sharing smarter today!
